p: Frequent changes in feeding sites due to the persistence of the essential oil in the plant tissue are another factor that may have influenced whitefly oviposition. This may reduce phloem sap suction, leading to a decrease in the number of mature eggs for deposition [ 16, 56]. Reduced feeding and oviposition can also be influenced by the detection of some volatile substances by chemoreceptors present in the insectâ€™s tarsi, deterring oviposition [ 52, 57].
